description:
Provides an Amplify App resource, a fullstack serverless app hosted on the [AWS Amplify Console](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/amplify/latest/userguide/welcome.html).

~> **Note:** When you create/update an Amplify App from Terraform, you may end up with the error "BadRequestException: You should at least provide one valid token" because of authentication issues. See the section "Repository with Tokens" below.

BasicAuthCredentials.description: The basic authorization credentials for the autocreated branch.

BuildSpec.description: The build specification (build spec) for the autocreated branch.

EnableAutoBuild.description: Enables auto building for the autocreated branch.

EnableBasicAuth.description: Enables basic authorization for the autocreated branch.

EnablePerformanceMode.description: Enables performance mode for the branch.

EnablePullRequestPreview.description: Enables pull request previews for the autocreated branch.

EnvironmentVariables.description: The environment variables for the autocreated branch.

Framework.description: The framework for the autocreated branch.

PullRequestEnvironmentName.description: The Amplify environment name for the pull request.

Stage.description: Describes the current stage for the autocreated branch. Valid values: `PRODUCTION`, `BETA`, `DEVELOPMENT`, `EXPERIMENTAL`, `PULL_REQUEST`.

Condition.description: The condition for a URL rewrite or redirect rule, such as a country code.

Source.description: The source pattern for a URL rewrite or redirect rule.

Status.description: The status code for a URL rewrite or redirect rule. Valid values: `200`, `301`, `302`, `404`, `404-200`.

Target.description: The target pattern for a URL rewrite or redirect rule.

tfcfnid.description: Internal identifier for tracking resource changes. Do not use.

AccessToken.description: The personal access token for a third-party source control system for an Amplify app. The personal access token is used to create a webhook and a read-only deploy key. The token is not stored.

AutoBranchCreationPatterns.description: The automated branch creation glob patterns for an Amplify app.

BasicAuthCredentials.description: The credentials for basic authorization for an Amplify app.

BuildSpec.description: The [build specification](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/amplify/latest/userguide/build-settings.html) (build spec) for an Amplify app.

Description.description: The description for an Amplify app.

EnableAutoBranchCreation.description: Enables automated branch creation for an Amplify app.

EnableBasicAuth.description: Enables basic authorization for an Amplify app. This will apply to all branches that are part of this app.

EnableBranchAutoBuild.description: Enables auto-building of branches for the Amplify App.

EnableBranchAutoDeletion.description: Automatically disconnects a branch in the Amplify Console when you delete a branch from your Git repository.

EnvironmentVariables.description: The environment variables map for an Amplify app.

IamServiceRoleArn.description: The AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) service role for an Amplify app.

Name.description: The name for an Amplify app.

OauthToken.description: The OAuth token for a third-party source control system for an Amplify app. The OAuth token is used to create a webhook and a read-only deploy key. The OAuth token is not stored.

Platform.description: The platform or framework for an Amplify app. Valid values: `WEB`.

Repository.description: The repository for an Amplify app.

Tags.description: Key-value mapping of resource tags. If configured with a provider [`default_tags` configuration block](/docs/providers/aws/index.html#default_tags-configuration-block) present, tags with matching keys will overwrite those defined at the provider-level.
